column1: mvglasow/satstat,closed,Fix issue computing DMS Seconds value.,[],"The abs call on minutes causes the subtractions for second to move further from 0, not closer.
This appears to work and fix the issue. Tested in in Android Studio.
The seconds in the longitude is wrong because the longitude is negative.
Just in case you are not aware someone published your app on Google Play:
mvglasow/satstat,closed,Why the `PasvLocListenerService` service is always running ?,"[Label(name=""question"")]","I have activated the options to be notified when another app is using the GPS.
On my phone the `PasvLocListenerService` service is always running after SatStat is launched and never stopped.
If I kill the app (so the service is not running), when another app is using the GPS, the notification icon is well displayed, I think thanks to this :
So I wonder why there is a service kept running.
Thanks for this very useful app ! :)"
mvglasow/satstat,open,"Show ""ephemeris"" for each satellite",[],"This may require the Android 7+ GNSS API, but I think that's ok.

Satstat shows a blue or red bar depending on whether the particular satellite is used in the solution.   Another important thing is whether the ephemeris is current.   I suggest showing a hollow bar to show no ephemeris.  Really, I suggest hollow to show not used, solid for used, and red for no ephemeris, blue for ephemeris, but that's a bigger change.  The point is to match what Garmin units do, but there I think tracking and ephemeris leads to use.

A curiousity is that gpstest shows that GLONASS satellites are sometimes/often used with almanac but without ephemeris.  This seems odd, as I would expect the position computed from almanac to be so high uncertainty as not to be useful."

mvglasow/satstat,open,Show what's what in the map view,[],"In the map view you have these different markers and circles showing the position and accuracy of the different global navigation satellite systems, but it doesn't explain what the red circle is or what the gray marker is. Maybe a tool-tip or something clickable could be added"
mvglasow/satstat,open,graph ðŸ“ˆ for sensor data [Enhancement],[],It could be really good to have a way to graph data from sensors.
mvglasow/satstat,open,Galileo satellites,[],Can you make to show the Galileo sats too? Or is it planned for the future?

mvglasow/satstat,open,Play store upload,[],Hey. I like your app but I can't install anything outside of play store. I'll gladly pay for developer account for you and a small extra personally for you. Just contact me by direct message with your preferred payment method

mvglasow/satstat,open,Feature request: GPS logging,[],Is there any possibility a button can be added to the GPS screen to start/stop recording all the GPS info to a CSV file? Something I can easily import into QGIS whereas most apps are designed for a specific use case.
mvglasow/satstat,closed,Main (satellite) screen stops working,[],"My location can be determined in the map screen, but the main (satellite) screen is only able to show the number of satellites (0/n).

It worked the first time I used the app, but for some reason it has stopped working. I've tried force stopping, clearing app data and revoking and re-allowing location access. But the problem is still not fixed. How do I provide useful information for debugging?"

mvglasow/satstat,closed,No Glonass-detection and no AGPS-data update on one device but on another identical one,[],"I'm absolutely not convinced if I'm reporting a bug but at least I want to mention this weird situation.

Running Satstat v3.3 on two identical devices (details below), and while the two devices are ""sitting"" side by side one of the devices doesn't detect Glonass and doesn't update the AGPS-data due to an ostensibly not available network (but the network is definitely available and used by other applications) while the second device recognises Glonass and performs the AGPS-data update.

Screenshots from both devices are attached, also a Logcat from the device with the issue. For privacy reasons, some parts of the screenshots are pixeled out, some private data in the Logcat are ""X""-ed out.
Hopefully, someone can assist in troubleshooting.
OS Ressurection Remix-Nougat v5.8.5-final, Magisk v16.0, Boeffla-Kernel, XPosed, XPrivacyLua, AFWall+
All permissions grated to Satstat. ROM- and kernel settings absolutely the same. Same settings in XPrivacyLua and AFWall+.
mvglasow/satstat,open,crash on opening downloadpath,[],Hi. when I try to set the downloadfolder Satstat always crashes.
The browser app complains about a null pointer exception

java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.mixplorer/com.mixplorer.activities.BrowseActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'int com.mixplorer.e.ae$a.ordinal()' on a null object reference
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'int com.mixplorer.e.ae$a.ordinal()' on a null object reference
mvglasow/satstat,open,Donations,[],Thank you for satstat. Please add your bitcoin address to your f-droid page and github.
mvglasow/satstat,open,Oreo adaptive icon shape,[],"Please add support for icon shape

mvglasow/satstat,open,Continue searching for satellites when screen is off or app is in background,"[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","I would like to request the ability to enable the app to keep searching/fixing while in the background.
This app is one of the best ways to debug problems with other apps that use GPS, and to ""pre-search"" for satellites for other apps that are going to need them.
* Put a button with an ""hourglass"" or ""lock"" icon on the main satellite screen
* Tapping it will lead to a popup window with time options (e.g. 1,5,10 minutes, Until Manually Disabled).
* Once activated, SatStat would continue searching for satellites even in the background, for the specified period of time.
The reason I suggest this UI is to avoid inadvertently draining the battery by keeping GPS on. (Probably the reason SatStat stops searching when in the background in its current behavior!)
Thank you for this fantastic app."

mvglasow/satstat,open,"Offline Maps - eg. World map, special maps, regional maps",[],"It would be nice to be able to download offline maps directly into the maps path specified. I would like to use this because:
1.) I would like to see a (rough) world map (which is unfortunately not available in the map downloads catalogue but directly at http://download.mapsforge.org/maps/
2.) I would like to use a smaller regional or special map that -I download manually to the maps folder
Unfortunately SatStat seems not to recognize maps that are manually downloaded in that folder. Perhaps it's just an issue to register those maps?
It should be then also told in the settings which osm-map-version is needed. By comparing one dowloaded map with the maps available from mapsforge I believe it's /v4."
mvglasow/satstat,open,Logo design for satstat,[],"Hi, do you want a logo and icons for this app? I will give free to you"
This small and useless PR adds a button to get your app on F-Droid. You can later add a button for Google Play the same way :
` `"
I've just completed the French translation for satstat.

mvglasow/satstat,open,"""Elevation"" is unclear (ellipsoidal height vs orthometric height)",[],"SatStat shows ""Elevation"".   From reading the code, it's clear that it uses  Android's Location.getAltitude(), which is defined to be ellipsoidal height.   From experimenting, that seems true for the internal GPS receiver, but someone on the OsmAnd list reports that an external bluetooth GPSr --  hooked up somehow -- results in SatStat showing a value that seems more likely to be orthometric height.
Unfortunately the Android API is misnamed
column2: altitude almost never means ellipsoidal height.  It's hard to think of a better word that won't mislead or confuse.  My two suggestions are ""Ellips. Hght""  (Or ""Ell. H"" if that is what fits) and ""HAE"".

column1: mvglasow/satstat,open,Add mmHg (Torr) for pressure sensor,[Label(name=""enhancement"")]",Please add mmHg unit for pressure sensor. It is common unit of atmospheric pressure in some countries.

mvglasow/satstat,open,zoom setting does not recover from zooming out,[],"In the map tab, the view is widened to fit a low-accuracy location report, as is typical with cell-based location.  That's arguably very sensible.   However, the map does not return to the user-commanded zoom when the low-accuracy report is replaced by one that is more accurate.  (I realize this will get trickier if and when more providers are shown.)
Please comment with either ENOPATCH or ""not a bug and I wouldn't merge such a change""..."
mvglasow/satstat,closed,Set sensor update interval to 100 ms,[],"This is chosen to allow the human to read the numbers and validate

mvglasow/satstat,closed,sensor update rate is too high,[],"I just updated to today's git master.  In the sensors view, the acceleration, rotation and magnetic field numbers are changing so fast that 1) I worry about battery drain (without a good basis) and more importantly 2) I can't really read the numbers.    Before, I don't really remember the update rate, but it seemed ok.   So I wonder if it should be limited to 10 Hz, or 5 Hz, or something like that, instead of what seems (without having read the code) like ""as fast as possible""."

mvglasow/satstat,closed,crashes with openbmap location provider with nearly-1GB us.sqlite,"[Label(name=""awaiting feedback"")]","This is a fuzzy report, but I am curious if someone else is seeing this.
I'm running satstat from 2017-06-19 on a relatively modern no-gapps ROM.   I have unifiednlp and several providers.  Until recently, satstat had behaved very well.

Just now I added DejaVu, and have been watching the map view with satstat.  All has seemed sensible.  I updated the mapsforge file from June of 2016 to recent today, and drove for about 45 minutes with that new file and DejaVu with no issues.  Then, I updated the radiocells/openbmap database to the currently-available us.sqlite, which is nearly 1 GB, compared to under 200 MB from before (yes, somethhng seems amiss)., and disabled DejaVu and enabled the openbmap backend.   I was seeing mostly-reasonable data, but found that satstat would crash every few minutes.

So I wonder if something is going wrong with such a huge database, and if the location backend or satstat is running out of memory, or something else.  No logs at the moment, but I can try to get one.
(I've also inquired about the unexpected size of the radiocells db file.)"

mvglasow/satstat,open,(Embarrassed cough) - Play Store for African users?,[],"I'm working in Africa with the Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team doing, well, humanitarian mapping. My team is working on almost 100% free software: GNU/Linux on the PCs, OpenDataKit for data collection, QGIS for analysis and presentation, etc.
SatStat is absolutely brilliant, and I'm migrating my team off of the proprietary sensor data apps (GPS Essentials, GPS Status & Toolbox).

I've shared the SatStat via f-droid for my core team, and that's fine, but it would be a lot easier for us to spread the word and get our academic and NGO partners on this if it were in the Play Store.
I'd rather promote f-droid, of course, and am doing so with my core team, but having SatStat on Google Play would help more people in Africa get more access to good quality free software like this.
I'll understand if you don't want to do it. Just asking!"

mvglasow/satstat,closed,"Bump build tools, remove exact Java dependency",[],"* This updates `build.gradle` to run from a fresh clone using Android Studio 2.3.3

* The `compileOptions` Java versions prevent the project from building on a machine that has only Java 8 installed.  By removing the explicit version of Java it should build on any machine (with a compatible Java version for Android Studio or Gradle."

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Remove extra 0 from sensor refresh rate,[],"When running an on LG G5 w/ Android 7.0 (stock), the sensor refresh rate seems very low (see https://github.com/mvglasow/satstat/issues/122#issuecomment-331667328).
Here's the current master branch at https://github.com/mvglasow/satstat/commit/5f10dd41f5543ecb826cc54e697cbc0d83588216, which is around 3fps:
Looking at the comments, it appears there is an extra 0 in the refresh rate.  This patch removes the extra 0.
Here's this patch on same device, running at ~26fps:

mvglasow/satstat,open,Map downloader shows size of large files as -1,"[Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","The offline map downloader shows -1 for the size of some map files. This has been observed for the map of France, which is 2.2G in size (as of 2017-08-18, which is the most recent version).

Deeper analysis of the code shows that `HttpDownloader.getFileInfo()` uses `java.net.URLConnection.getContentLength()` to get the file size. According to its javadoc, this method returns -1 if content length is not supplied or cannot be represented as a 32-bit integer (i.e. anything over 2 GiB)."

It is used by amateur radio operators to exchange information about location."

mvglasow/satstat,open,Compass Challenges w/ Google Pixel,[Label(name=""awaiting feedback"")]","I had the compass working fine on my Google Pixel XL, but after doing a hard reset on the phone I can't get the satellites to display anymore. I'd like to get that back.
- GPS tracking is obviously already turned on
- There is no 'Settings' -> 'Data usage' -> ""Google Services"" on a Pixel
- Settings > Location > Three dots in top right corner > Scanning > Enable ""Wi-Fi Scanning"" is on
- says how many satellites it finds (eg. 0/12, or 0/19) and this changes over time being in the same spot
- the SatStat 'map' feature finds my location
Any thoughts on why is used to work and now it doesn't? What am I missing?

mvglasow/satstat,open,Show some info when location mode is set to ""Battery saving""","[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","It would be good to have some information when location mode is set to ""Battery saving"" (i.e. GPS is disabled).
Right now it shows no satellites which may be confusing if you are not aware of this setting.

mvglasow/satstat,open,Added ability to menu to copy current location to the clipboard.,[],In reference to issue #95 I have added the ability to copy the current location to your clipboard, which can be pasted into any other application.

I used the text views to pull the data for the clipboard because if you do not have a position, then you will get - - instead of an error or nothing. And it will copy the location in the method specified in settings menu. If you choose MGRS, Decimal, Dec min, DDMMSS, it still copies as you set in your settings preferences.

I have tested this on a Samsung Galaxy S4, Android 7.1.2, using MGRS, Decimal, Decimal Minutes, and Decimal Minutes Seconds. All copied without error. I also tested if you have no location, still copies to clipboard without error, just as "" - - ""."
mvglasow/satstat,closed,Compass not working on Galaxy S3/LineageOS 14.1,"[Label(name=""resolved"")]","Hi,
I recently refurbished a Samsung Galaxy S III (GT-I9300) with LineageOS 14.1 (previous ROM was stock) before giving it to a friend.
However, SatStat (F-Droid v3.2 2017-06-23) doesn't show any compass orientation : the north arrow stays frozen to the 12 o'clock position.
I first thought that the GT-I9300 had no magnetic compass (odd, but why not ?), but other apps such as GPS Status & Toolbox report magnetic orientation just fine, so I believe it's a SatStat issue.
Please note that not having my hands on the device anymore, I'll need a bit more time to have my friend test and report back. :-)
I'll have him check the sensors page (cf https://github.com/mvglasow/satstat/issues/37), and have a look at the logcat too."

mvglasow/satstat,open,Show the DOP values (GPS accuracy/precision),[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","I would be nice to see the [dilution of precision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dilution_of_precision_(navigation)) (DOP) values. This would give better insight into the time, vertical, horizontal and overall precision of the measurements compared to the standard horizontal error displayed. Looks like it would be a fun little math project."
mvglasow/satstat,open,Excessive - signals in south and/or west coordinates,"[Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","Good morning.
I live in the south and west part of our planet. When using SatStatÂ´s show of GPS data in degree/minute/second format in my tiny smartphone, the seconds of degree of latitude simply donÂ´t appear.
While seeing -22Âº53'35,0"" and -50Âº25'33,6"" would be better.
In a larger smpartphone all the excessive minus signals appeared, but I had the seconds of degree because the font size used allowed all data have space in the screen.
Can you remove excessive minus signals please?
mvglasow/satstat,open,Inefficient API is used in SatStat,[Label(name=""awaiting feedback"")]","Dear developers,
I found an inefficient API, setImageResource(), is widely used in SatStat.

This does Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause a latency hiccup. If that's a concern, consider using setImageDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) or setImageBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap) and BitmapFactory instead. ""
I noticed that in the following code, setImageResource() is used:
Do you think the use of setImageResource() will affect SatStat's performance? If so, maybe we should move Bitmap reading and decoding to a background thread.
mvglasow/satstat,closed,Closes on change from sat display to others,[Label(name=""awaiting feedback"")]",On Nexus 6 with Android 7.1.1 build N6F26Q.
mvglasow/satstat,open,App crashes trying to download maps when there is no internet connection,"[Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","Hey Michael,
I really like SatStats map download dialog, so I've included it in the Radiobeacon alpha release.
@ReyhanJB recently reported an issue, where app crashes, when trying to download map while phone is in flight mode. SatStat (latest F-Droid release) also seems to be affected.

Nevertheless for RadioBeacon this is fixed by a simple null check, which might also be necessary for SatStat to fix the issue, see https://github.com/openbmap/radiocells-scanner-android/commit/47d2c706b62fcaadb22cb09420af63abdbc53f90

mvglasow/satstat,open,Status of non-GPS sats shown incorrectly since Android 7,"[Label(name=""awaiting feedback"")]","The SNR view at the bottom of the main screen shows all non-GPS satellites (GLONASS,...) in red, ""not used in fix"". Are they really not used by the device? I think they are and just the status is shown incorrectly. As far as I can tell this started when I upgraded to Android 7.
This article (unfortunately in German) seems to describe the issue:

If I understand right, the GPS API of older Android versions did not officially return a ""used in fix"" info. Since Android 7 this is officially supported, but a new API has to be used for this, probably android.location.GnssStatus .

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Offline Map of Germany incomplete,[],The offline map of Germany is totally incomplete at the moment. There are absolutely no roads, buildings, etc included. It just shows the coastline and a few names, nothing else. The download is surprisingly small with just 20MB. It used to work and the download used to be much larger (>500MB as far as I remember).
Could you replace the download file with a working version again?
mvglasow/satstat,open,No margin on left or right,[],The contents of the main views has no margin and touches the edges of the screen. An 8 or 16 dp margin would fix this.

mvglasow/satstat,open,Galileo ID range,"[Label(name=""enhancement""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","I've confirmed Galileo ID range on at least one Android M or older device to be 301-330 (BQ Aquaris X5+, with Qualcomm chipset).
I've added it to my app here, as well as Android N explicit support for Galileo and other GNSS:
I wanted to know how (potential) Galileo Satellites are displayed.

mvglasow/satstat,open,"Suggestion: show satellite count in the ""searching for location"" notification message","[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","When waiting for a location fix, I often find myself opening SatStat's ""Searching for location"" notification message and tapping my way to its main view, just so I can watch the acquired satellite count progress. I'm effectively using this count like a progress bar, because it's less frustrating than staring at the app that needs the fix with no indication at all of whether I'll be waiting for seconds or minutes. Unfortunately, I currently have to leave the app to do this.

It would be handy if SatStat's ""Searching"" notification message was continually updated with the satellite count, so I could watch the progress toward a fix without leaving the app I'm working with.

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Application crashes when clicking on ""Settings""","[Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","Today I decided to upgrade from 2.2 to 3.0 and I wanted to see what's new. I clicked on ""Settings"" and the application crashed, then I decided to check where the bug is and fix it. The exception was the following:

>                                                                              java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.vonglasow.michael.satstat/com.vonglasow.michael.satstat.SettingsActivity}: android.view.InflateException: Binary XML file line #11: Error inflating class java.lang.reflect.Constructor
>                                                                               Caused by: android.view.InflateException: Binary XML file line #11: Error inflating class java.lang.reflect.Constructor

I used git-bisect to find which commit introduced the bug and I found out it was this one https://github.com/mvglasow/satstat/commit/0cddd4a9a0b318f702d5f4dededf9f0c022a6740. Then I played with the code and I found which line caused the crash and it was this one https://github.com/mvglasow/satstat/blob/0cddd4a9a0b318f702d5f4dededf9f0c022a6740/res/xml/preferences.xml#L8. When I swap lines 7 and 8 the application no longer crashes and it can be used as a workaround. ""ListPreference"" can't be the last item in a ""PreferenceCategory"" for some unknown reason.
Tested with SDK versions 14, 17 and 23. The application doesn't crash when using version 23.

mvglasow/satstat,closed,add way to see both unsplit cellid and RNCID/CID, or quick mechanism to change","[Label(name=""enhancement""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","I like being able to split, but it seems the world is such that both representations are and wlll be in use.    So I'd like to be able to absorb both easily.
- On phones there isn't enough room, so if all cells reported have the same mcc/mnc, put mcc/mnc after the ""GSM"" and omit those columns.  Then add both representations.
- Add a line with the other form for the current cell (only).
- have a short tap on the cell table (or in that CID column) change the preference.
Probably the third approach is easiest and is probably enough to solve the problem with minimal display impact to others.

mvglasow/satstat,open,Device orientation vs. compass issues,[Label(name=""awaiting feedback"")]","During testing of #75 I found out that the orientation provided by Android is not too good - particularly, it the documentation says it should only be used when roll is small.
Once you rotate the device upside-down, the north heading is inverted on the compass (in a bad way). Also near the maximum roll, it behaves weirdly.

On the other hand, this seems to be common ""behavior"" among many apps, so perhaps this issue can be marked as won't-fix. I will probably later fix the leveller tool to use accelerometer, rather than the orientation data.

mvglasow/satstat,open,Showing almanac, ephemeris and other sat data â€“ please discuss","[Label(name=""awaiting feedback""), Label(name=""enhancement"")]","This ticket came out of merge request #48, which already got some input.
Currently, the sky plot and SNR graph use two different colors to show whether or not a satellite is used in the current fix
column2: signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) is represented by dot diameter/bar length. The SNR chart additionally shows which GNSS each satellite belongs to (GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, others) â€“ though this is going to be improved, see #64.

column1: The merge request proposes to also implement visualization of almanac and ephemeris availability. In total, each satellite has five ""dimensions"" which could be of interest:
- whether the satellite is used in the current fix (currently represented by color)
- GNSS system (currently represented by position in SNR chart, possibly by shape in sky plot)

Availability of augmentation systems (SBAS) has also been suggested, but I'd have to look into how this is implemented: is that a per-satellite flag, a per-GNSS flag or a global one? These systems present themselves as additional satellites (see https://github.com/mvglasow/satstat/wiki/NMEA-IDs#sbas), which should already be visible.

I'm looking for ideas how to best represent all of these. Some devices report bogus data (e.g. a satellite is used in the fix despite having no almanac or ephemeris), which also need to be visualized. Therefore, we really have to treat these five dimensions independently.
We may need to limit ourselves to showing certain dimensions only in one of the two graphs.

As for visual dimensions, apart from size, color and position, we could also consider shape (circle, square, triangle...), luminance and saturation, as well as border color, or maybe hollow vs. filled dots.

We'd have to watch out for ""interference"" between dimensions: fill/border distinctions as well as different shapes get hard to distinguish at small sizes (weak signal or lots of sats in the SNR chart)
column2: using luminance and saturation together might result in very similar colors.

column1: mvglasow/satstat,closed,Show satellite country,[Label(name=""duplicate"")]","It would be nice if there would be the possibility to see the country of the satellite. Maybe by form or color. Then you can see if the device can detect only the US satellites or/and also the Russian, Chinese...

mvglasow/satstat,closed,No location permission => app exception,[Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""resolved"")]","After installing the app, it may not have the location permissions enabled (in my case, Android 6.0.1 + ADB). Then the following happens:

`java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to resume activity {com.vonglasow.michael.satstat/com.vonglasow.michael.satstat.MainActivity}: java.lang.SecurityException: ""network"" location provider requires ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission.`
Correct behavior would be to not show location - but the app should not terminate with exception... E.g. GPSTest works this way.

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Disable/grey out ""Reload AGPS data"" for incompatible devices",[],"Hi,
It took me a lot of time to understand (after playing with both SatStat and GPS Status & Toolbox) why reloading AGPS data did not properly work with my Samsung Galaxy Nexus (maguro) :
1- Reload AGPS data query is a fire-and-forget action with no control/status update
2- The Galaxy Nexus features a SiRFstar IV GPS chip which (according to this : http://pocketnow.com/hardware-1/sirfstar-iv-to-compete-with-agps-for-fast-acquisition-times) does not use AGPS
- can anyone confirm the AGPS incompatibility of the Galaxy Nexus ?

- if so, is there any way to disable/grey out the ""Reload AGPS data"" for incompatible devices ? It would save a lot of time to people unaware of this fact (like I was) who tried to improve their GPS but could not understand whyâ€¦

Using my modification I found that my three Android devices behave totally different and feedback from API is sometimes strange and sometimes obviously wrong (e.g. I have a fix, but the API says that there is no ephemeris and almanac available).
With visual info it is much easier to report a bug.
Here there is an example how this feature looks like (white=has ephemeris, green=has almanac):

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Reload AGPS data command does nothing,[],A network trace (taken on the WiFi router to which the phone is conected) shows that when the user selects â€œReload AGPS dataâ€ from the menu, the phone makes an outside HTTP request (for captive portal detection) but no further traffic is detected, despite SatStat showing a toast saying that a data reload was requested.
However, when starting SatStat (and location updates are being requested from GPS), the SUPL requests are clearly visible in the trace.
Apparently the GPS driver stack ignores the extra location provider command.
Tested on a Nexus S running Cyanogenmod 11. YMMV on other devices.

There is no easy way to fix on-demand AGPS download (this would require forcing all apps that are currently registered with GPS to unregister and re-register, which is not possible). However, the command can only be invoked from the main SatStat activity, and bringing it up will request location updates and thus trigger an AGPS update, so it is less of an issue here.

It is an issue for scheduled AGPS updates (e.g. when a data connection becomes available). Here it can be mitigated by registering for GPS location updates and immediately unregistering again. This will trigger an AGPS update if the GPS is not in use at that time.

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Screen orientation locking code incorrectly assume natural orientation to be portrait,[Label(name=""bug"")]","I happened to own a 10-inch tablet and its natural orientation is landscape. According to commit 9f70b409ee356fe784ee7ce9f672906e17123695, it is assuming that 0-degree rotation means portrait which is an incorrect assumption on this device. Also according to the [Android reference](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/Display.html#getRotation%28%29) a 0-degree rotation does not assume portrait orientation. This issue is causing the screen to rotate too frequently and lock up the device, requiring a hard reboot to quit the app.
The device is a Samsung GALAXY Tab 2 10.1 running CyanogenMod 10.1.3.

mvglasow/satstat,closed,Infinite AGPS update loop,[],Under certain conditions, SatStat may go into an infinite loop in which it will attempt to reload AGPS data permanently, ignoring any limits set in the user preferences.
